info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 7:21PM EDT until July 05 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN ALAMANCE...NORTHERN RANDOLPH AND SOUTHERN GUILFORD COUNTIES... At 721 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Thomasville to 9 miles northeast of Randleman to 9 miles southwest of Graham, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... High Point, Burlington, Graham, Randleman, Mebane, Archdale, Trinity, Pleasant Garden, Liberty and Swepsonville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
